Operation 'ExportSingleSendStat' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The original summary 'Export Single Send Stats' is generic and doesn't specify the output format. The description, while informative about the mechanics, lacks clarity about what metrics are included in the export and doesn't explicitly state that this is a read-only operation. Enhanced summary specifies CSV format for better AI agent understanding. Improved description adds: (1) explicit mention of performance metrics included (bounces, clicks, opens), (2) clarification that this is a read-only operation with no side effects, (3) better structure for AI agent parsing of inputs and outputs, and (4) consistency with the API's domain terminology around 'metrics' and 'engagement statistics'.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to export Single Send stats as .CSV data**.

You can specify one Single Send or many: include as many Single Send IDs as you need, separating them with commas, as the value of the `ids` query string parameter.

The data is returned as plain text response but in .CSV format, so your application making the call can present the information in whatever way is most appropriate, or just save the data as a .csv file.
data.summary_suggestion: Export Single Send statistics in CSV format
data.description_suggestion: Exports performance statistics for one or more Single Send campaigns in CSV format. Accepts multiple Single Send IDs as comma-separated values in the `ids` query parameter. Returns plain text CSV data containing metrics such as bounces, clicks, opens, and other engagement statistics. The response can be directly saved as a .csv file or parsed by your application for further processing. No data is modified by this operation.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Export Single Send Stats' is generic and doesn't specify the output format. The description, while informative about the mechanics, lacks clarity about what metrics are included in the export and doesn't explicitly state that this is a read-only operation. Enhanced summary specifies CSV format for better AI agent understanding. Improved description adds: (1) explicit mention of performance metrics included (bounces, clicks, opens), (2) clarification that this is a read-only operation with no side effects, (3) better structure for AI agent parsing of inputs and outputs, and (4) consistency with the API's domain terminology around 'metrics' and 'engagement statistics'.

message: Operation 'ExportAutomationStat' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology, missing_output_details. The summary incorrectly references 'Single Send Stats' when the path indicates this is for Automations (/v3/marketing/stats/automations/export). The description has inconsistent terminology and lacks clarity about the output format and use cases. Improved version corrects the terminology to 'Automation', clarifies the CSV output format, and explains the practical use cases for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to export Single Send stats as .CSV data**.

You can specify one Single Send or many: include as many Single Send IDs as you need, separating them with commas, as the value of the `ids` query string parameter.

The data is returned as plain text response but in .CSV format, so your application making the call can present the information in whatever way is most appropriate, or just save the data as a .csv file.
data.description_suggestion:
**This endpoint allows you to export Automation stats in CSV format.**

You can export stats for one or multiple Automations by providing comma-separated Automation IDs in the `ids` query string parameter. The response returns CSV-formatted data as plain text that can be saved directly as a .csv file or processed by your application. This is useful for analyzing Automation performance data in external tools or for record-keeping purposes.
data.reasoning: The summary incorrectly references 'Single Send Stats' when the path indicates this is for Automations (/v3/marketing/stats/automations/export). The description has inconsistent terminology and lacks clarity about the output format and use cases. Improved version corrects the terminology to 'Automation', clarifies the CSV output format, and explains the practical use cases for AI agent understanding.

Operation 'ExportSingleSendStat' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The original summary 'Export Single Send Stats' is generic and doesn't specify the output format. The description, while informative about the mechanics, lacks clarity about what metrics are included in the export and doesn't explicitly state that this is a read-only operation. Enhanced summary specifies CSV format for better AI agent understanding. Improved description adds: (1) explicit mention of performance metrics included (bounces, clicks, opens), (2) clarification that this is a read-only operation with no side effects, (3) better structure for AI agent parsing of inputs and outputs, and (4) consistency with the API's domain terminology around 'metrics' and 'engagement statistics'.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to export Single Send stats as .CSV data**.

You can specify one Single Send or many: include as many Single Send IDs as you need, separating them with commas, as the value of the `ids` query string parameter.

The data is returned as plain text response but in .CSV format, so your application making the call can present the information in whatever way is most appropriate, or just save the data as a .csv file.
data.summary_suggestion: Export Single Send statistics in CSV format
data.description_suggestion: Exports performance statistics for one or more Single Send campaigns in CSV format. Accepts multiple Single Send IDs as comma-separated values in the `ids` query parameter. Returns plain text CSV data containing metrics such as bounces, clicks, opens, and other engagement statistics. The response can be directly saved as a .csv file or parsed by your application for further processing. No data is modified by this operation.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Export Single Send Stats' is generic and doesn't specify the output format. The description, while informative about the mechanics, lacks clarity about what metrics are included in the export and doesn't explicitly state that this is a read-only operation. Enhanced summary specifies CSV format for better AI agent understanding. Improved description adds: (1) explicit mention of performance metrics included (bounces, clicks, opens), (2) clarification that this is a read-only operation with no side effects, (3) better structure for AI agent parsing of inputs and outputs, and (4) consistency with the API's domain terminology around 'metrics' and 'engagement statistics'.

message: Operation 'ExportAutomationStat' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology, missing_output_details. The summary incorrectly references 'Single Send Stats' when the endpoint path indicates it's for Automations (/v3/marketing/stats/automations/export). The description has inconsistent terminology and unclear output format explanation. Improved version corrects the terminology to 'Automation Stats', clarifies the input format, and better explains the CSV output format for AI agent understanding.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to export Single Send stats as .CSV data**.

You can specify one Single Send or many: include as many Single Send IDs as you need, separating them with commas, as the value of the `ids` query string parameter.

The data is returned as plain text response but in .CSV format, so your application making the call can present the information in whatever way is most appropriate, or just save the data as a .csv file.
data.description_suggestion: Retrieves statistics for one or more Automations and exports them in CSV format. Accepts multiple Automation IDs as a comma-separated list via the `ids` query string parameter. Returns plain text data formatted as CSV, allowing your application to parse, display, or save the statistics to a .csv file.
data.reasoning: The summary incorrectly references 'Single Send Stats' when the endpoint path indicates it's for Automations (/v3/marketing/stats/automations/export). The description has inconsistent terminology and unclear output format explanation. Improved version corrects the terminology to 'Automation Stats', clarifies the input format, and better explains the CSV output format for AI agent understanding.
